New Records: The Toronto Raptors lost by 30 points to the Cleveland Cavaliers, breaking a record as the worst season opener result in franchise history.
Key Match Events: The team was outscored 36-17 in the second quarter and committed more turnovers than they made shots.
Evan Mobley scored 25 points for the Cavaliers.
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: Montreal's Chris Boucher said in a post-game interview, “We got slapped in the face. It was probably good for us, especially as young as we are. It’s not easy to win games, so I think it’s good for us to realize that the season has actually started and we have to play a lot harder than we did tonight.”
Another post-game quote from an X user, “I kind of felt like I was watching the Blue Jays at mid season. Didn’t last for the 2nd half.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Raptors will face the Philadelphia 76ers on Friday for a second chance at a home soil win this season.
Others: RJ Barrett is injured and is expected to return to the court soon, which may improve the team’s performance.
The Raptors are still in the early stages of the season, and this loss may be a wake-up call for the team.
